title: How to Make a Coriander and Chili Tomato Omelette

steps.headline: Dice the onions and tomatoes.
steps.description: Cut the fresh coriander and chilies roughly.

steps.headline: Add the cream and spices to a small mixing bowl.
Crack the two eggs into the cream mixture.
Add the diced vegetables and the coriander and chili.
Add some vegetable oil to the frying pan.
Tip the omelette mixture into the frying pan.
steps.description: Cook the eggs until they bubble on top. Cook over a medium heat.

steps.headline: Flip the omelette over.
steps.description: Use a spatula to gently flip the omelette to the other side. Keep cooking for another minute or two, until the omelette is no longer runny.

steps.headline: Use a spatula to fold the omelette in half (if wished).
steps.description: Gently roll the cooked omelette onto a serving plate.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Sprinkle with some chopped fresh coriander (cilantro).

text: Dice the onions and tomatoes. Cut the fresh coriander and chilies roughly. Add the cream and spices to a small mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Crack the two eggs into the cream mixture.  Add the diced vegetables and the coriander and chili. Whisk. Add some vegetable oil to the frying pan.  Tip the omelette mixture into the frying pan. Cook the eggs until they bubble on top. Cook over a medium heat. Flip the omelette over. Use a spatula to gently flip the omelette to the other side. Keep cooking for another minute or two, until the omelette is no longer runny. Use a spatula to fold the omelette in half (if wished). Gently roll the cooked omelette onto a serving plate. Serve. Sprinkle with some chopped fresh coriander (cilantro).
